profile_overview: Paxos is a regulated blockchain infrastructure company building transparent and transformative financial solutions.
profile_bio:
Paxos is building the foundation for the open financial system. We are a regulated blockchain infrastructure company building transparent and transformative financial solutions. We create accessible blockchain infrastructure that’s instantaneous and reliable, 24/7 - whether it’s enabling crypto features for enterprises, launching the world’s first fully-regulated, asset-backed tokens (USDP & PAXG), or setting a new standard of efficiency for settlement of securities.

We empower today’s financial leaders to build a more open, trusted economy. These leaders include PayPal, Mercado Libre, Interactive Brokers and Mastercard.

MeetAn Dinh, a Software Engineer on the Blockchain Core team at Paxos. An and her team provide and maintain internal APIs for Paxos, as well as build out infrastructures to support workflows for different chains, such as transfers, withdrawals and deposits. Hear from An about why blockchain development was a fit for her:

"My parents work in the finance industry, and one of the pain points for them is always the very, very slow speed of moving assets around," said An. "At Paxos, I feel like I can help be a part of the shift to invigorate and improve on the current financial system, and that makes me very excited."

She also described some of the unique challenges of being a blockchain developer:

"We work with different chains all the time, so there are always new challenges every single day. You're never seeing two blockchains that are exactly the same, as some have benefits on one side and some have benefits on the other. It's always really nice to be able to do the research and readings into the blockchains to make informed decisions based on the data you've collected."

As for tips to anyone looking to break into blockchain development, here’s what An had to say:

"First off, I would recommend reading up on the blockchain that you're interested in. It’s important to get in the habit of staying on top of the latest research, as blockchain technologies are ever-growing and ever-changing. Next, set up a local chain. Many blockchains are open-source and have very quick guides of how to get started in their development, so playing around with a local chain in your own time can really help you get familiar with it."

And finally, the most fun thing about working at Paxos?

"It's fun working at Paxos because my team is amazing. We lean on each other, support each other and cover for each other in times of need. I'm working with some amazing engineers here who teach me a lot about development, deployments and how to make our system more secure to protect the assets of our customers. That is something that I've never experienced anywhere else, and I am really grateful to be able to learn that here at Paxos."

profile_overview: Paxos is a regulated blockchain infrastructure company building transparent and transformative financial solutions.
profile_bio:
Paxos is building the foundation for the open financial system. We are a regulated blockchain infrastructure company building transparent and transformative financial solutions. We create accessible blockchain infrastructure that’s instantaneous and reliable, 24/7 - whether it’s enabling crypto features for enterprises, launching the world’s first fully-regulated, asset-backed tokens (USDP & PAXG), or setting a new standard of efficiency for settlement of securities.

We empower today’s financial leaders to build a more open, trusted economy. These leaders include PayPal, Mercado Libre, Interactive Brokers and Mastercard.

MeetAn Dinh, a Software Engineer on the Blockchain Core team at Paxos. An and her team provide and maintain internal APIs for Paxos, as well as build out infrastructures to support workflows for different chains, such as transfers, withdrawals and deposits. Hear from An about why blockchain development was a fit for her:

"My parents work in the finance industry, and one of the pain points for them is always the very, very slow speed of moving assets around," said An. "At Paxos, I feel like I can help be a part of the shift to invigorate and improve on the current financial system, and that makes me very excited."

She also described some of the unique challenges of being a blockchain developer:

"We work with different chains all the time, so there are always new challenges every single day. You're never seeing two blockchains that are exactly the same, as some have benefits on one side and some have benefits on the other. It's always really nice to be able to do the research and readings into the blockchains to make informed decisions based on the data you've collected."

As for tips to anyone looking to break into blockchain development, here’s what An had to say:

"First off, I would recommend reading up on the blockchain that you're interested in. It’s important to get in the habit of staying on top of the latest research, as blockchain technologies are ever-growing and ever-changing. Next, set up a local chain. Many blockchains are open-source and have very quick guides of how to get started in their development, so playing around with a local chain in your own time can really help you get familiar with it."

And finally, the most fun thing about working at Paxos?

"It's fun working at Paxos because my team is amazing. We lean on each other, support each other and cover for each other in times of need. I'm working with some amazing engineers here who teach me a lot about development, deployments and how to make our system more secure to protect the assets of our customers. That is something that I've never experienced anywhere else, and I am really grateful to be able to learn that here at Paxos."

profile_overview: Paxos is a regulated blockchain infrastructure company building transparent and transformative financial solutions.
profile_bio:
Paxos is building the foundation for the open financial system. We are a regulated blockchain infrastructure company building transparent and transformative financial solutions. We create accessible blockchain infrastructure that’s instantaneous and reliable, 24/7 - whether it’s enabling crypto features for enterprises, launching the world’s first fully-regulated, asset-backed tokens (USDP & PAXG), or setting a new standard of efficiency for settlement of securities.

We empower today’s financial leaders to build a more open, trusted economy. These leaders include PayPal, Mercado Libre, Interactive Brokers and Mastercard.

MeetAn Dinh, a Software Engineer on the Blockchain Core team at Paxos. An and her team provide and maintain internal APIs for Paxos, as well as build out infrastructures to support workflows for different chains, such as transfers, withdrawals and deposits. Hear from An about why blockchain development was a fit for her:

"My parents work in the finance industry, and one of the pain points for them is always the very, very slow speed of moving assets around," said An. "At Paxos, I feel like I can help be a part of the shift to invigorate and improve on the current financial system, and that makes me very excited."

She also described some of the unique challenges of being a blockchain developer:

"We work with different chains all the time, so there are always new challenges every single day. You're never seeing two blockchains that are exactly the same, as some have benefits on one side and some have benefits on the other. It's always really nice to be able to do the research and readings into the blockchains to make informed decisions based on the data you've collected."

As for tips to anyone looking to break into blockchain development, here’s what An had to say:

"First off, I would recommend reading up on the blockchain that you're interested in. It’s important to get in the habit of staying on top of the latest research, as blockchain technologies are ever-growing and ever-changing. Next, set up a local chain. Many blockchains are open-source and have very quick guides of how to get started in their development, so playing around with a local chain in your own time can really help you get familiar with it."

And finally, the most fun thing about working at Paxos?

"It's fun working at Paxos because my team is amazing. We lean on each other, support each other and cover for each other in times of need. I'm working with some amazing engineers here who teach me a lot about development, deployments and how to make our system more secure to protect the assets of our customers. That is something that I've never experienced anywhere else, and I am really grateful to be able to learn that here at Paxos."

profile_overview: Paxos is a regulated blockchain infrastructure company building transparent and transformative financial solutions.
profile_bio:
Paxos is building the foundation for the open financial system. We are a regulated blockchain infrastructure company building transparent and transformative financial solutions. We create accessible blockchain infrastructure that’s instantaneous and reliable, 24/7 - whether it’s enabling crypto features for enterprises, launching the world’s first fully-regulated, asset-backed tokens (USDP & PAXG), or setting a new standard of efficiency for settlement of securities.

We empower today’s financial leaders to build a more open, trusted economy. These leaders include PayPal, Mercado Libre, Interactive Brokers and Mastercard.

MeetAn Dinh, a Software Engineer on the Blockchain Core team at Paxos. An and her team provide and maintain internal APIs for Paxos, as well as build out infrastructures to support workflows for different chains, such as transfers, withdrawals and deposits. Hear from An about why blockchain development was a fit for her:

"My parents work in the finance industry, and one of the pain points for them is always the very, very slow speed of moving assets around," said An. "At Paxos, I feel like I can help be a part of the shift to invigorate and improve on the current financial system, and that makes me very excited."

She also described some of the unique challenges of being a blockchain developer:

"We work with different chains all the time, so there are always new challenges every single day. You're never seeing two blockchains that are exactly the same, as some have benefits on one side and some have benefits on the other. It's always really nice to be able to do the research and readings into the blockchains to make informed decisions based on the data you've collected."

As for tips to anyone looking to break into blockchain development, here’s what An had to say:

"First off, I would recommend reading up on the blockchain that you're interested in. It’s important to get in the habit of staying on top of the latest research, as blockchain technologies are ever-growing and ever-changing. Next, set up a local chain. Many blockchains are open-source and have very quick guides of how to get started in their development, so playing around with a local chain in your own time can really help you get familiar with it."

And finally, the most fun thing about working at Paxos?

"It's fun working at Paxos because my team is amazing. We lean on each other, support each other and cover for each other in times of need. I'm working with some amazing engineers here who teach me a lot about development, deployments and how to make our system more secure to protect the assets of our customers. That is something that I've never experienced anywhere else, and I am really grateful to be able to learn that here at Paxos."

profile_overview: Paxos is a regulated blockchain infrastructure company building transparent and transformative financial solutions.
profile_bio:
Paxos is building the foundation for the open financial system. We are a regulated blockchain infrastructure company building transparent and transformative financial solutions. We create accessible blockchain infrastructure that’s instantaneous and reliable, 24/7 - whether it’s enabling crypto features for enterprises, launching the world’s first fully-regulated, asset-backed tokens (USDP & PAXG), or setting a new standard of efficiency for settlement of securities.

We empower today’s financial leaders to build a more open, trusted economy. These leaders include PayPal, Mercado Libre, Interactive Brokers and Mastercard.

MeetAn Dinh, a Software Engineer on the Blockchain Core team at Paxos. An and her team provide and maintain internal APIs for Paxos, as well as build out infrastructures to support workflows for different chains, such as transfers, withdrawals and deposits. Hear from An about why blockchain development was a fit for her:

"My parents work in the finance industry, and one of the pain points for them is always the very, very slow speed of moving assets around," said An. "At Paxos, I feel like I can help be a part of the shift to invigorate and improve on the current financial system, and that makes me very excited."

She also described some of the unique challenges of being a blockchain developer:

"We work with different chains all the time, so there are always new challenges every single day. You're never seeing two blockchains that are exactly the same, as some have benefits on one side and some have benefits on the other. It's always really nice to be able to do the research and readings into the blockchains to make informed decisions based on the data you've collected."

As for tips to anyone looking to break into blockchain development, here’s what An had to say:

"First off, I would recommend reading up on the blockchain that you're interested in. It’s important to get in the habit of staying on top of the latest research, as blockchain technologies are ever-growing and ever-changing. Next, set up a local chain. Many blockchains are open-source and have very quick guides of how to get started in their development, so playing around with a local chain in your own time can really help you get familiar with it."

And finally, the most fun thing about working at Paxos?

"It's fun working at Paxos because my team is amazing. We lean on each other, support each other and cover for each other in times of need. I'm working with some amazing engineers here who teach me a lot about development, deployments and how to make our system more secure to protect the assets of our customers. That is something that I've never experienced anywhere else, and I am really grateful to be able to learn that here at Paxos."

profile_overview: Paxos is a regulated blockchain infrastructure company building transparent and transformative financial solutions.
profile_bio:
Paxos is building the foundation for the open financial system. We are a regulated blockchain infrastructure company building transparent and transformative financial solutions. We create accessible blockchain infrastructure that’s instantaneous and reliable, 24/7 - whether it’s enabling crypto features for enterprises, launching the world’s first fully-regulated, asset-backed tokens (USDP & PAXG), or setting a new standard of efficiency for settlement of securities.

We empower today’s financial leaders to build a more open, trusted economy. These leaders include PayPal, Mercado Libre, Interactive Brokers and Mastercard.

MeetAn Dinh, a Software Engineer on the Blockchain Core team at Paxos. An and her team provide and maintain internal APIs for Paxos, as well as build out infrastructures to support workflows for different chains, such as transfers, withdrawals and deposits. Hear from An about why blockchain development was a fit for her:

"My parents work in the finance industry, and one of the pain points for them is always the very, very slow speed of moving assets around," said An. "At Paxos, I feel like I can help be a part of the shift to invigorate and improve on the current financial system, and that makes me very excited."

She also described some of the unique challenges of being a blockchain developer:

"We work with different chains all the time, so there are always new challenges every single day. You're never seeing two blockchains that are exactly the same, as some have benefits on one side and some have benefits on the other. It's always really nice to be able to do the research and readings into the blockchains to make informed decisions based on the data you've collected."

As for tips to anyone looking to break into blockchain development, here’s what An had to say:

"First off, I would recommend reading up on the blockchain that you're interested in. It’s important to get in the habit of staying on top of the latest research, as blockchain technologies are ever-growing and ever-changing. Next, set up a local chain. Many blockchains are open-source and have very quick guides of how to get started in their development, so playing around with a local chain in your own time can really help you get familiar with it."

And finally, the most fun thing about working at Paxos?

"It's fun working at Paxos because my team is amazing. We lean on each other, support each other and cover for each other in times of need. I'm working with some amazing engineers here who teach me a lot about development, deployments and how to make our system more secure to protect the assets of our customers. That is something that I've never experienced anywhere else, and I am really grateful to be able to learn that here at Paxos."

profile_overview: Paxos is a regulated blockchain infrastructure company building transparent and transformative financial solutions.
profile_bio:
Paxos is building the foundation for the open financial system. We are a regulated blockchain infrastructure company building transparent and transformative financial solutions. We create accessible blockchain infrastructure that’s instantaneous and reliable, 24/7 - whether it’s enabling crypto features for enterprises, launching the world’s first fully-regulated, asset-backed tokens (USDP & PAXG), or setting a new standard of efficiency for settlement of securities.

We empower today’s financial leaders to build a more open, trusted economy. These leaders include PayPal, Mercado Libre, Interactive Brokers and Mastercard.

MeetAn Dinh, a Software Engineer on the Blockchain Core team at Paxos. An and her team provide and maintain internal APIs for Paxos, as well as build out infrastructures to support workflows for different chains, such as transfers, withdrawals and deposits. Hear from An about why blockchain development was a fit for her:

"My parents work in the finance industry, and one of the pain points for them is always the very, very slow speed of moving assets around," said An. "At Paxos, I feel like I can help be a part of the shift to invigorate and improve on the current financial system, and that makes me very excited."

She also described some of the unique challenges of being a blockchain developer:

"We work with different chains all the time, so there are always new challenges every single day. You're never seeing two blockchains that are exactly the same, as some have benefits on one side and some have benefits on the other. It's always really nice to be able to do the research and readings into the blockchains to make informed decisions based on the data you've collected."

As for tips to anyone looking to break into blockchain development, here’s what An had to say:

"First off, I would recommend reading up on the blockchain that you're interested in. It’s important to get in the habit of staying on top of the latest research, as blockchain technologies are ever-growing and ever-changing. Next, set up a local chain. Many blockchains are open-source and have very quick guides of how to get started in their development, so playing around with a local chain in your own time can really help you get familiar with it."

And finally, the most fun thing about working at Paxos?

"It's fun working at Paxos because my team is amazing. We lean on each other, support each other and cover for each other in times of need. I'm working with some amazing engineers here who teach me a lot about development, deployments and how to make our system more secure to protect the assets of our customers. That is something that I've never experienced anywhere else, and I am really grateful to be able to learn that here at Paxos."

profile_overview: Paxos is a regulated blockchain infrastructure company building transparent and transformative financial solutions.
profile_bio:
Paxos is building the foundation for the open financial system. We are a regulated blockchain infrastructure company building transparent and transformative financial solutions. We create accessible blockchain infrastructure that’s instantaneous and reliable, 24/7 - whether it’s enabling crypto features for enterprises, launching the world’s first fully-regulated, asset-backed tokens (USDP & PAXG), or setting a new standard of efficiency for settlement of securities.

We empower today’s financial leaders to build a more open, trusted economy. These leaders include PayPal, Mercado Libre, Interactive Brokers and Mastercard.

MeetAn Dinh, a Software Engineer on the Blockchain Core team at Paxos. An and her team provide and maintain internal APIs for Paxos, as well as build out infrastructures to support workflows for different chains, such as transfers, withdrawals and deposits. Hear from An about why blockchain development was a fit for her:

"My parents work in the finance industry, and one of the pain points for them is always the very, very slow speed of moving assets around," said An. "At Paxos, I feel like I can help be a part of the shift to invigorate and improve on the current financial system, and that makes me very excited."

She also described some of the unique challenges of being a blockchain developer:

"We work with different chains all the time, so there are always new challenges every single day. You're never seeing two blockchains that are exactly the same, as some have benefits on one side and some have benefits on the other. It's always really nice to be able to do the research and readings into the blockchains to make informed decisions based on the data you've collected."

As for tips to anyone looking to break into blockchain development, here’s what An had to say:

"First off, I would recommend reading up on the blockchain that you're interested in. It’s important to get in the habit of staying on top of the latest research, as blockchain technologies are ever-growing and ever-changing. Next, set up a local chain. Many blockchains are open-source and have very quick guides of how to get started in their development, so playing around with a local chain in your own time can really help you get familiar with it."

And finally, the most fun thing about working at Paxos?

"It's fun working at Paxos because my team is amazing. We lean on each other, support each other and cover for each other in times of need. I'm working with some amazing engineers here who teach me a lot about development, deployments and how to make our system more secure to protect the assets of our customers. That is something that I've never experienced anywhere else, and I am really grateful to be able to learn that here at Paxos."

profile_overview: Paxos is a regulated blockchain infrastructure company building transparent and transformative financial solutions.
profile_bio:
Paxos is building the foundation for the open financial system. We are a regulated blockchain infrastructure company building transparent and transformative financial solutions. We create accessible blockchain infrastructure that’s instantaneous and reliable, 24/7 - whether it’s enabling crypto features for enterprises, launching the world’s first fully-regulated, asset-backed tokens (USDP & PAXG), or setting a new standard of efficiency for settlement of securities.

We empower today’s financial leaders to build a more open, trusted economy. These leaders include PayPal, Mercado Libre, Interactive Brokers and Mastercard.

MeetAn Dinh, a Software Engineer on the Blockchain Core team at Paxos. An and her team provide and maintain internal APIs for Paxos, as well as build out infrastructures to support workflows for different chains, such as transfers, withdrawals and deposits. Hear from An about why blockchain development was a fit for her:

"My parents work in the finance industry, and one of the pain points for them is always the very, very slow speed of moving assets around," said An. "At Paxos, I feel like I can help be a part of the shift to invigorate and improve on the current financial system, and that makes me very excited."

She also described some of the unique challenges of being a blockchain developer:

"We work with different chains all the time, so there are always new challenges every single day. You're never seeing two blockchains that are exactly the same, as some have benefits on one side and some have benefits on the other. It's always really nice to be able to do the research and readings into the blockchains to make informed decisions based on the data you've collected."

As for tips to anyone looking to break into blockchain development, here’s what An had to say:

"First off, I would recommend reading up on the blockchain that you're interested in. It’s important to get in the habit of staying on top of the latest research, as blockchain technologies are ever-growing and ever-changing. Next, set up a local chain. Many blockchains are open-source and have very quick guides of how to get started in their development, so playing around with a local chain in your own time can really help you get familiar with it."

And finally, the most fun thing about working at Paxos?

"It's fun working at Paxos because my team is amazing. We lean on each other, support each other and cover for each other in times of need. I'm working with some amazing engineers here who teach me a lot about development, deployments and how to make our system more secure to protect the assets of our customers. That is something that I've never experienced anywhere else, and I am really grateful to be able to learn that here at Paxos."
